[[Cheryl Misak|Author]

> Peirce’s point is that a genuine belief—one that is aimed at truth—is such that it resigns in the face of recalcitrant experience or in the knowledge that it was put into place by a method that did not take experience seriously.

— [American Pragmatism and Indispensability Arguments](/docs/phil/American Pragmatism and Indispensability Arguments.html)
